Class Constants

java.lang.Object
com.github.bhlangonijr.chesslib.Constants
public class Constants extends Object
A handy collection of constant values to be used in common scenarios.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final Move
    DEFAULT_BLACK_OO
    The shift of the black king in a default short castle move.
    static final List<Square>
    DEFAULT_BLACK_OO_ALL_SQUARES
    The list of all squares involved in the case of short castle of black.
    static final List<Square>
    DEFAULT_BLACK_OO_SQUARES
    The list of squares crossed by the black king in the case of short castle.

    • pieceNotation

      @Deprecated public static final EnumMap<Piece,String> pieceNotation
      Deprecated.
      use Piece.getFenSymbol() instead
      The map that returns the Forsyth-Edwards Notation (FEN) symbols by piece.

    • pieceNotationR

      @Deprecated public static final Map<String,Piece> pieceNotationR
      Deprecated.
      use Piece.fromFenSymbol(String) instead
      The map that returns a piece by its Forsyth-Edwards Notation (FEN) symbol.

    • emptyMove

      public static final Move emptyMove
      A useful special value that represents an empty move, that is, a move that does nothing and leaves the board unchanged.

  • Method Details

    • getPieceNotation

      @Deprecated public static String getPieceNotation(Piece piece)
      Deprecated.
      use Piece.getFenSymbol() instead
      Returns the Forsyth-Edwards Notation (FEN) symbol for a piece.
      Parameters:
      piece - a piece to get the FEN symbol from
      Returns:
      the Forsyth-Edwards Notation symbol of the piece

    • getPieceByNotation

      @Deprecated public static Piece getPieceByNotation(String notation)
      Deprecated.
      use Piece.fromFenSymbol(String) instead
      Returns the piece corresponding to the given Forsyth-Edwards Notation (FEN) symbol.
      Parameters:
      notation - a piece FEN symbol
      Returns:
      the piece that corresponds to the FEN symbol provided in input
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the input symbol does not correspond to any standard chess piece
